# BLVNK Canvas — Digital & Systems Architecture Blueprint ## Department 6 of 7 | Phase 4: Digital Experience **Date:** February 12, 2026 --- ## 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY This report defines the complete digital architecture for BLVNK Canvas — from website UX to conversion funnels to the technology stack powering the Brand Intelligence System (BIS). Every decision is rooted in cognitive psychology, scanning pattern research, and performance engineering. **The digital thesis:** The BLVNK Canvas website IS the first taste of the BIS. If the website feels generic, the prospect assumes the intelligence system is generic too. The website must feel like stepping into the product — precise, dark, intelligent, and responsive. **Core principle:** Progressive disclosure. The prospect encounters the brand like an intelligence briefing — headline → context → evidence → action. Never all information at once. --- ## 2. AUDIENCE COGNITIVE PROFILE ### 2.1 Primary Audience: Founders & CEOs (30-50) | Factor | Assessment | Design Implication | |--------|------------|-------------------| | Digital comfort | High (digital-native entrepreneurs) | Can handle dark mode, minimalist UI, subtle interactions | | Decision mode | System 2 (high-stakes purchase, $5k-$30k) | Needs clear value evidence, not impulse triggers. No countdown timers, no fake urgency | | Scanning behavior | Layer-Cake (scan headings, skip body) | Every heading must tell the story independently | | Time availability | Low (busy founders) | Get to the point fast. 5-second test is critical | | Device split | 60% mobile (LinkedIn discovery) → 40% desktop (deep consideration) | Mobile-first for discovery, desktop-optimized for conversion | | Trust triggers | Proof, specificity, methodology (NOT badges, awards, testimonials from unknowns) | Show process, show numbers, show system thinking | ### 2.2 Intent-Based Journey Map | Stage | Intent | Scanning Pattern | Platform | Content Need | |-------|--------|-------------------|----------|-------------| | **Discovery** | Informational (via LinkedIn post) | F-Pattern (article/thread) | Mobile | Problem validation. "Do they understand my pain?" | | **Interest** | Informational → Evaluative | Z-Pattern (landing page) | Mobile → Desktop | Category education. "What is a BIS?" | | **Consideration** | Evaluative | Layer-Cake (service details) | Desktop | Methodology proof. "How does this work?" | | **Decision** | Transactional | Z-Pattern (proposal/pricing page) | Desktop | Pricing, scope, timeline. "What exactly do I get?" | | **Action** | Transactional | Single-focus (booking page) | Desktop | Calendar scheduling. Minimal friction | --- ## 3. INFORMATION ARCHITECTURE ### 3.1 Sitemap ``` blvnkcanvas.com/ ├── / (Homepage — Hero → Problem → Category → Proof → CTA) ├── /intelligence (What is a Brand Intelligence System?) ├── /process (The Seven Departments methodology) ├── /work (Case studies / Before-After intelligence snapshots) ├── /pricing (Tiered: Sprint → Recon → Launch Kit → Enterprise) ├── /start (Booking / Application page) └── /blog (LinkedIn content repurposed for SEO) ``` ### 3.2 Page Priority & Purpose | Page | Primary Goal | Secondary Goal | Priority | |------|-------------|----------------|----------| | Homepage `/` | Communicate category + differentiation in 5 seconds | Drive to `/start` or `/intelligence` | #1 | | Intelligence `/intelligence` | Educate on BIS — what it is, why static decks fail | Drive to `/process` or `/start` | #2 | | Process `/process` | Build authority through methodology transparency | Drive to `/pricing` | #3 | | Pricing `/pricing` | Present tiered options with anchoring/decoy structure | Drive to `/start` | #4 | | Start `/start` | Convert — booking CTA | Capture lead info | #5 | | Work `/work` | Social proof through outcomes (not testimonials) | Drive to `/start` | #6 | ### 3.3 Navigation Rules - **Desktop:** Horizontal nav, 5 items max: Intelligence | Process | Work | Pricing | **Start** (CTA button) - **Mobile:** Hamburger menu (acceptable — founder audience is digitally literate) - **Sticky nav:** Yes. Appears after scrolling past hero section. Contains brand wordmark + CTA button - **Click depth to conversion:** Maximum 2 clicks from any page to `/start` --- ## 4. HOMEPAGE WIREFRAME BLUEPRINT ### 4.1 Section-by-Section Architecture **Section 1: Hero (Z-Pattern)** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ BLVNK Canvas (logo, top-left) [Start] (top-right) │ │ │ │ Your brand, decoded. │ │ [Instrument Serif, 48px, Warm White] │ │ │ │ The brand intelligence system that │ │ replaces guesswork with certainty. │ │ [Inter, 18px, Silver] │ │ │ │ [Book Intelligence Briefing] (Signal Blue) │ │ [See how it works] (Ghost button) │ │ │ │ ↓ subtle scroll indicator │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - Z-Pattern: Logo (top-left) → CTA (top-right) → Diagonal scan → Primary CTA (center-bottom) - No hero image. Pure typography. The absence of imagery IS the statement (Quiet Luxury) - Scroll indicator prevents Illusion of Completeness - 70%+ whitespace in hero section **Section 2: Problem (The Villain)** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ The $50,000 PDF nobody opens. │ │ [Inter Semibold, 36px] │ │ │ │ You invested in brand strategy. │ │ They gave you a document. │ │ You downloaded it once. │ │ Now it sits in a folder labeled "Brand Stuff." │ │ [Inter Regular, 18px, staggered fade-in] │ │ │ │ Meanwhile, every decision is still a guess. │ │ [Instrument Serif Italic, 22px, Signal Blue] │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - F-Pattern shift — text-heavy problem section - Each sentence fades in sequentially (100ms stagger) — Magician reveal pattern - Loss aversion trigger: "$50,000" anchors the cost of the old approach - Final line in accent font + Signal Blue — semiotic emphasis **Section 3: Category Introduction** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ What if your brand strategy could answer back? │ │ [Instrument Serif, 36px] │ │ │ │ ┌─────────────┐ ┌─────────────┐ │ │ │ Dead │ │ Brand │ │ │ │ Deliverable │ │ Intelligence│ │ │ │ │ │ System │ │ │ │ Static PDF │ │ Living, │ │ │ │ 90+ pages │ │ queryable │ │ │ │ Read once │ │ Grows with │ │ │ │ Outdated │ │ your brand │ │ │ └─────────────┘ └─────────────┘ │ │ [Ghost border] [Signal Blue border] │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - Split-screen comparison — two columns - Left card (old way) uses Ghost border, slightly dimmed text - Right card (BIS) uses Signal Blue border, full brightness - Gestalt: Proximity + Similarity — the two cards are clearly related but clearly different - This is where the category is named and defined **Section 4: Methodology Teaser (3-Step Process)** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Three steps. Zero guesswork. │ │ │ │ 01 ──── Decode 02 ──── Build │ │ We interrogate your Seven departments │ │ market, competitors, engineer your │ │ and psychology. intelligence system. │ │ │ │ 03 ──── Launch │ │ You deploy with a │ │ system that evolves, │ │ not a deck that decays. │ │ │ │ [See the full methodology →] │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - Numbered steps with monospace (JetBrains Mono) — Creator precision signal - Progressive disclosure: teaser here, full breakdown on `/process` - This matches the StoryBrand "Plan" step — giving the hero a clear path **Section 5: Social Proof (Outcomes, Not Testimonials)** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Built for founders who are done guessing. │ │ │ │ ┌──────────┐ ┌──────────┐ ┌──────────┐ │ │ │ 7 │ │ 1 │ │ 93% │ │ │ │ Intelligence│ │ Unified │ │ First-use│ │ │ │ departments│ │ system │ │ clarity │ │ │ └──────────┘ └──────────┘ └──────────┘ │ │ │ │ "This isn't a brand. It's a competitive │ │ advantage I can query." │ │ — [Founder attribution, if available] │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - Stat cards use monospace font for numbers — data/intelligence feeling - One testimonial maximum (specificity > quantity). Only use if real and specific - No star ratings, no generic praise, no headshots **Section 6: CTA (Closing)** ``` ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Stop guessing. Start knowing. │ │ [Inter Semibold, 36px] │ │ │ │ [Book your intelligence briefing] │ │ (Signal Blue, full-width on mobile) │ │ │ │ Free 30-minute session. No pitch. │ │ Just your brand, decoded. │ │ [Silver text, 14px] │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Design notes:** - Direct CTA (StoryBrand framework) — primary action, no ambiguity - "No pitch" = reduces friction (loss aversion: they won't lose 30 minutes to a sales call) - Tagline callback: "Your brand, decoded." closes the loop --- ## 5. CONVERSION FRAMEWORK ### 5.1 CTA Strategy | Page | Primary CTA | Type | Placement | |------|-------------|------|-----------| | Homepage | "Book intelligence briefing" | Direct | After value established (mid-scroll + end) | | Intelligence | "See how it works" → `/process` | Transitional | End of education content | | Process | "See pricing" → `/pricing` | Transitional | After methodology proof | | Pricing | "Start your project" → `/start` | Direct | At each tier, with Launch Kit emphasized | | Blog | "Download the [resource]" | Transitional | Mid-article and sidebar | ### 5.2 Friction Management | Action | Friction Level | Design | |--------|---------------|--------| | Booking a call (`/start`) | **Intentional ritualistic friction** | Short application form: Name, Company, URL, "What's your biggest brand challenge?" — positions as exclusive, not commodity | | Reading blog content | **Near-zero friction** | No email gate on blog posts. Value-first. Gate only downloadable resources | | Viewing pricing | **Near-zero friction** | Transparent pricing on the page. No "request a quote" for standard tiers | | Navigating site | **Zero friction** | Sticky nav, 2-click max to any page | ### 5.3 Pricing Page Architecture (Behavioral Economics) ``` ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ │ │ ┌──────────┐ ┌──────────────┐ ┌──────────┐ │ │ │ Brand │ │ LAUNCH KIT │ │ Market │ │ │ │ Sprint │ │ │ │ Recon │ │ │ │ │ │ "Most │ │ │ │ │ │ $1,500 │ │ founders │ │ $5,000 │ │ │ │ │ │ choose this"│ │ │ │ │ │ 1 dept │ │ │ │ 3 depts │ │ │ │ 5 days │ │ $12,000 │ │ 10 days │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ [Start] │ │ All 7 depts │ │ [Start] │ │ │ │ Ghost │ │ 30 days │ │ Ghost │ │ │ │ button │ │ │ │ button │ │ │ │ │ │ [Start] │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ Signal Blue │ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ FULL CTA │ │ │ │ │ └──────────┘ └──────────────┘ └──────────┘ │ │ │ │ Enterprise: $30,000+ | Custom scope | [Contact us] │ │ │ └────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ``` **Behavioral design:** - **Anchoring:** Enterprise ($30k) shown as a text line below — anchors high so $12k feels reasonable - **Decoy effect:** Market Recon ($5k for 3 depts) vs. Launch Kit ($12k for 7 depts) — the per-department value of Launch Kit is overwhelmingly better - **Social proof label:** "Most founders choose this" on the target tier - **Visual emphasis:** Launch Kit card is slightly larger, uses Signal Blue border and CTA. Other tiers use Ghost buttons - **Order:** Sprint (lowest) → **Launch Kit** (center, emphasized) → Recon (middle price). Intentional C-position bias (center items receive more attention) --- ## 6. TECHNOLOGY ARCHITECTURE ### 6.1 Stack Recommendation | Layer | Technology | Rationale | |-------|-----------|-----------| | **Frontend** | HTML + CSS + Vanilla JS (static site) | Maximum performance. No framework overhead. LCP target demands speed. Solo operation = no need for React/Next.js complexity | | **Styling** | CSS Custom Properties (design tokens from Dept 5) | All colors, spacing, typography as variables. Dark mode IS default, no toggle needed | | **Hosting** | Vercel or Netlify (static hosting) | Free tier. Global CDN. Automatic SSL. GitHub integration for deployment | | **CMS / Blog** | Markdown files → Static site generator or manual | Content is infrequent (weekly LinkedIn reposts). No CMS overhead needed | | **Analytics** | Plausible or Fathom (privacy-first) | GDPR-compliant without consent banners. Founders respect privacy-respecting tools. Signal: we practice what we preach (intelligence without surveillance) | | **Forms** | Supabase or Formspree | Lead capture without backend complexity | | **Scheduling** | Cal.com or Calendly embed | Booking integration on `/start` page | | **Email** | ConvertKit (creator-tier) or Loops | Sequence automation for transitional CTA follow-ups | ### 6.2 Performance Budget | Asset Type | Budget | Strategy | |-----------|--------|----------| | Total page weight | ≤ 500KB | Minimal imagery, system fonts fallback, no video autoplay | | Fonts | ≤ 100KB | Inter (variable font, single file), Instrument Serif (subset), JetBrains Mono (subset) | | CSS | ≤ 50KB | Single stylesheet, CSS custom properties, no framework | | JavaScript | ≤ 50KB | Scroll animations (IntersectionObserver), form handling, nav toggle. No jQuery, no React | | Images | ≤ 200KB total | WebP format, lazy loading, architectural/abstract only (per Dept 5). Hero section is pure typography — 0KB images | | Third-party | ≤ 100KB | Analytics script + scheduling embed only | ### 6.3 Core Web Vitals Targets | Metric | Target | Strategy | |--------|--------|----------| | **LCP** | ≤ 1.5s (better than 2.5s requirement) | No hero image. Font preloading. CDN hosting. Typography-first hero = near-instant LCP | | **INP** | ≤ 100ms | Minimal JS. No heavy event listeners. CSS transitions for hover/focus states | | **CLS** | 0 | No layout shifts. Font-display: swap with matched fallback. No dynamic ad injection | --- ## 7. DESIGN SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION ### 7.1 CSS Custom Properties (Design Tokens from Dept 5) ```css :root { /* Colors */ --color-bg-primary: #0A0A0F; --color-bg-surface: #141419; --color-text-primary: #F5F1EB; --color-text-secondary: #94929D; --color-accent: #3B82F6; --color-border: #1E1E26; --color-success: #10B981; --color-warning: #F59E0B; /* Typography */ --font-heading: 'Inter', system-ui, sans-serif; --font-body: 'Inter', system-ui, sans-serif; --font-accent: 'Instrument Serif', Georgia, serif; --font-mono: 'JetBrains Mono', monospace; /* Spacing (8pt grid) */ --space-xs: 4px; --space-sm: 8px; --space-md: 16px; --space-lg: 24px; --space-xl: 32px; --space-2xl: 48px; --space-3xl: 64px; --space-4xl: 96px; /* Motion */ --ease-micro: 150ms ease-out; --ease-medium: 300ms cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); --ease-reveal: 500ms cubic-bezier(0.16, 1, 0.3, 1); /* Layout */ --max-width: 1280px; --radius-sm: 8px; --radius-md: 12px; } ``` ### 7.2 Responsive Breakpoints | Breakpoint | Width | Layout | |-----------|-------|--------| | Mobile (default) | < 768px | Single column, 4-col grid, 24px margins | | Tablet | 768px – 1024px | 8-col grid, 48px margins | | Desktop | > 1024px | 12-col grid, 80px margins, max-width 1280px | ### 7.3 Component Library Specification Components required for launch (priority order): | Component | Variants | Dept 5 Spec Reference | |-----------|----------|----------------------| | Button | Primary, Secondary, Ghost, Disabled | Section 8.2 | | Card | Default, Highlighted (Signal Blue border) | Section 8.1 | | Input | Default, Focus, Error, Disabled | Section 8.3 | | Navigation | Desktop horizontal, Mobile hamburger, Sticky | — | | Section container | Full-width, Max-width, Two-column | — | | Stat card | Number (monospace) + label | — | | Pricing card | Standard, Emphasized (center/target) | — | | Footer | Minimal — links, copyright, social icons | — | --- ## 8. SEO ARCHITECTURE ### 8.1 Technical SEO | Element | Specification | |---------|--------------| | Meta titles | `<60 chars`. ACCESSIBILITY AUDIT PLAN | Check | Standard | Method | |-------|----------|--------| | Color contrast (text) | WCAG AAA (7:1) for primary text on charcoal | Automated: aXe or Lighthouse | | Color contrast (interactive) | WCAG AA (4.5:1) for Signal Blue on dark | Manual: WebAIM contrast checker | | Keyboard navigation | All interactive elements focusable via Tab | Manual testing | | Screen reader | ARIA labels on nav, forms, modals, buttons | Manual: VoiceOver (macOS) | | Alt text | Every `` has descriptive alt text | Manual review | | Focus indicators | Visible focus ring on all interactive elements (Signal Blue outline) | Manual testing | | Reduced motion | `prefers-reduced-motion` media query disables animations | CSS implementation | --- ## 10. QUALITY GATES (Pre-Launch Checklist) | Gate | Test | Pass Criteria | |------|------|---------------| | **Squint Test** | Blur the page — do headline and CTA stand out? | ✅ Dark background, light text, Signal Blue CTA = high contrast hierarchy | | **5-Second Test** | Show page to non-user for 5 seconds — can they state the purpose? | "Brand strategy / intelligence system / consulting" | | **Thumb Zone Test** | Primary mobile CTA reachable? | CTA button full-width at bottom of each section | | **Illusion of Completeness** | Does hero look "finished"? | No — scroll indicator + content teaser visible below fold | | **Performance** | LCP ≤ 2.5s, CLS ≤ 0.1 | Typography-first hero = sub-1.5s LCP target | | **Friction Audit** | Booking form too long? | 4 fields only: Name, Company, URL, Challenge | | **Accessibility** | WCAG AA minimum | Color contrast checked, ARIA roles, keyboard nav | --- ## 11. CASCADING RECOMMENDATIONS ### For Distribution & Growth Engine (Dept 7): 1. **LinkedIn content drives to homepage** — ensure UTM parameters on all links for tracking in Plausible/Fathom 2. **Blog content is repurposed LinkedIn posts** — no separate content pipeline needed 3. **Email sequences** triggered by transitional CTA conversions (resource downloads) — ConvertKit/Loops automation 4. **Social proof loop:** Outcomes data from completed BIS projects → `/work` page → LinkedIn case study posts → drives to homepage 5. **No paid advertising initially** — organic content + Lightning Strike approach (Dept 3). Paid channels added only after organic conversion benchmarks are established ### Technical Handoff Specifications: 1. **Design tokens** are defined in Section 7.1 — implement as the CSS custom properties shown 2. **Component specs** reference Dept 5 Section 8 — build as vanilla HTML/CSS components 3. **Animation behavior** follows Dept 5 Section 9 — use IntersectionObserver for scroll reveals 4. **Font loading:** Preload Inter (primary), lazy-load Instrument Serif and JetBrains Mono 5. **Image format:** WebP only, with JPEG fallback via `` element --- *Report prepared as Department 6 output for the BLVNK Canvas Launch Kit. Digital architecture must cascade to Distribution & Growth Engine (Dept 7) and maintain consistency with all prior departments.*
